page.title: 01Bideford:South+SouthEast.
page.content: The River Torridge, flowing centrally from south to north,is the most striking feature of this area.Farming is the predominant activity here mainly on land classified as Grade 3 M.A.F.F.. Urban development is confined to a small encroachment in the north on both sides of the river.The only other settlement is the small village of Landcross,the hamlet of Hallspill,and a small part of the dispersed village of Littleham.There is oneÂ£ national' route through the area the A386, which partly because of its Â£scenic' status attracts a large flow of traffic in the summer.Both the estuary of the river and nearby woodland, provide important habitat for wildlife.Much of the salt- marsh has been constituted an S.S.S.I.. The richness and fascination ofthe area is threatened by some current plans un- less Conservation is firmly adhered to.
